channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Dire Predictions On Ebola's Spread From Top Health Organizations
item.description: The World Health Organization warns of more than 20,000 cases by early November if help doesn't arrive quickly in West Africa. The CDC projects 1.4 million cases by late January.
item.content:encoded:
The World Health Organization warns of more than 20,000 cases by early November if help doesn't arrive quickly in West Africa. The CDC projects 1.4 million cases by late January.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Michaeleen Doucleff

item.title: Thousands Of Syrian Kurds Fleeing Islamic State
item.description: Robert Siegel speaks with Carol Batchelor, Turkey Representative for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, about the Syrian Kurds flooding into Turkey.
item.content:encoded:
Robert Siegel speaks with Carol Batchelor, Turkey Representative for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, about the Syrian Kurds flooding into Turkey.

» E-Mail This

item.title: U.S. Regional Partners Offer Vocal Support Of Syria Air Strikes
item.description: Overnight air strikes in Syria mark a major expansion of the U.S.-led war on ISIS — one that's bound to be controversial in the Middle East.
item.content:encoded:
Overnight air strikes in Syria mark a major expansion of the U.S.-led war on ISIS — one that's bound to be controversial in the Middle East.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Deb Amos

item.title: Nobelist Muhammad Yunus: Be A Go-Getter, Not A Job Getter
item.description: The founding father of "microcredit" is helping to judge a contest with maxidollars: the Clinton Global Initiative's Hult Prize, granting $1 million to a new business idea that'll help the poor.
item.content:encoded:
The founding father of "microcredit" is helping to judge a contest with maxidollars: the Clinton Global Initiative's Hult Prize, granting $1 million to a new business idea that'll help the poor.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Christopher Shea

item.title: ISIS Videos Employ 'Good Cop, Bad Cop' Approach
item.description: Robert Siegel talks to Peter Neumann about new ISIS production techniques and the release of their new video showing the kidnapped British journalist John Cantlie.
item.content:encoded:
Robert Siegel talks to Peter Neumann about new ISIS production techniques and the release of their new video showing the kidnapped British journalist John Cantlie.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Khorasan Group Composed Of Al-Qaida Veterans
item.description: One of the targets in overnight airstrikes in Syria was a little known al-Qaida offshoot called the Khorasan group.
item.content:encoded:
One of the targets in overnight airstrikes in Syria was a little known al-Qaida offshoot called the Khorasan group.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Dina Temple-Raston

item.title: At U.N., Attention Divided Between Air Strikes And Climate Chage
item.description: President Obama headed to the UN on Tuesday with a new bombing campaign underway in Syria and the ability to tout an Arab coalition against ISIS. Fighting the threat posed by ISIS is a major focus of the UN gathering in New York. The president also turned his attention to another global issue, climate change.
item.content:encoded:
President Obama headed to the UN on Tuesday with a new bombing campaign underway in Syria and the ability to tout an Arab coalition against ISIS. Fighting the threat posed by ISIS is a major focus of the UN gathering in New York. The president also turned his attention to another global issue, climate change.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Syria Air Strikes Targeted Command Sites, Training Facilities
item.description: The U.S., along with several Arab states, launched air strikes inside Syria overnight. The strikes targeted the group that calls itself the Islamic State.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S., along with several Arab states, launched air strikes inside Syria overnight. The strikes targeted the group that calls itself the Islamic State.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: At 'World Routes,' Airports Court Airlines To Bring In More Flights
item.description: Some describe World Routes as speed dating for the aviation industry, as airports try to court airlines and convince them to offer international flights in and out of their destinations.
item.content:encoded:
Some describe World Routes as speed dating for the aviation industry, as airports try to court airlines and convince them to offer international flights in and out of their destinations.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: David Schaper

item.title: Abbas Looks To Students In Palestinian Statehood Campaign
item.description: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas is hoping to persuade the international community to set a deadline for Palestinian statehood.
item.content:encoded:
Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas is hoping to persuade the international community to set a deadline for Palestinian statehood.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Even When Abortion Is Illegal, The Market May Sell Pills For Abortion
item.description: An ulcer drug is dramatically changing the face of back-alley abortions in developing countries and cutting the rate of maternal deaths. Misoprostol is widely available even where abortion is banned.
item.content:encoded:
An ulcer drug is dramatically changing the face of back-alley abortions in developing countries and cutting the rate of maternal deaths. Misoprostol is widely available even where abortion is banned.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Jason Beaubien

item.title: Before You Take A Bite Of That Mushroom, Consider This
item.description: Guess what scientists found lurking inside a common-looking packet of supermarket porcini? Three entirely new species of fungi. That's what happens when you sequence the DNA of your dinner.
item.content:encoded:
Guess what scientists found lurking inside a common-looking packet of supermarket porcini? Three entirely new species of fungi. That's what happens when you sequence the DNA of your dinner.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Alison Bruzek

item.title: Al-Qaida's Khorasan Group Led By Hard-Core Fighters
item.description: The group, which was targeted by U.S. airstrikes in Syria last night, has been on the U.S. radar for a while. Intelligence officials say they have tracked its individual members for years.
item.content:encoded:
The group, which was targeted by U.S. airstrikes in Syria last night, has been on the U.S. radar for a while. Intelligence officials say they have tracked its individual members for years.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Dina Temple-Raston

item.title: Meet The Global Groups That Alicia Keys Got Naked For
item.description: The Grammy-winning singer posed in the nude (in a G-rated way) to draw attention to a dozen charities. Here's a look at the goals of the global players — and what they'd do if money were no object.
item.content:encoded:
The Grammy-winning singer posed in the nude (in a G-rated way) to draw attention to a dozen charities. Here's a look at the goals of the global players — and what they'd do if money were no object.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Klibanoff

item.title: Obama Emphasizes Coalition In Comments On Syrian Strikes
item.description: President Obama spoke about airstrikes in Syria on Tuesday morning, moments before he left for New York for the United Nations General Assembly meeting.
item.content:encoded:
President Obama spoke about airstrikes in Syria on Tuesday morning, moments before he left for New York for the United Nations General Assembly meeting.

item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith
